intro: Legousia falcata subsp. castellana, commonly known as the Castellana legousia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and compact growth habit. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in open habitats such as slopes and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in some regions.
